channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Mortgage rates rise for the fourth week in a row. Where's it cheaper to rent?
‘Can AI be an artist?’ A Sotheby’s auction tests the answer, while human artists protest AI training
item.description: The auction house will sell a painting created by a humanoid robot.

item.title: Tesla now says cheaper cars are on the horizon—including possibly the rumored Model 2—after reportedly scrapping its plans for a $25,000 vehicle earlier this year
item.description: The company had long promised “an even more affordable car” after the Model S and Model 3.

item.title: Boeing's CEO wants to make it ‘great again.’ Here’s what’s standing in the way.
Why did India's biggest IPO this year falter on its debut?
item.description: Some cite unique elements of the listing as factors in its faltering IPO. Others, however, say sitting on the sidelines means losing out on long-term ...

item.title: Jump Trading is offering 4-day-a-week tech jobs with $175K salaries, but they come with a catch
item.description: The trading firm is hiring a “weekend warrior,” emphasis on the warrior.

item.title: Jamie Dimon worries ‘World War III has already begun’
U.S. will be ‘more pro-crypto’ after this election, no matter who wins, says Ripple CEO Garlinghouse
item.description: Ripple CEO Brad Garlinghouse is a big cynic on U.S. crypto regulation, but highly optimistic about the post-election environment around the corner.

item.title: Prominent data scientist on latest election odds: Trump leads, but Harris is gaining
item.description: Thomas Miller, a data scientist and professor at Northwestern University, says the 2024 presidential race has whipsawed over the past several weeks.

item.title: 23 Nobel prize winners push for Kamala Harris, calling her a ‘better steward of our economy’ than Trump
item.description: Economists say that tariffs and tax cuts make Trump’s plan weaker than Harris’

item.title: Polymarket says the whale betting heavily on Trump is a French individual
Here are Oppenheimer's best stock ideas heading into November
item.description: As October nears its end, Oppenheimer is eyeing some stocks that it thinks are slated for gains over the next year.

item.title: Why mortgage rates are back up to nearly 7%
Stocks making the biggest moves midday: Tesla, IBM, Whirlpool, Molina Healthcare and more
item.description: These are the stocks posting the largest moves in midday trading.

item.title: Mattel, Hasbro lower guidance ahead of holiday season
item.description: Toy giants Mattel and Hasbro decreased 2024 guidance prior to the holiday season as toy sales continue to fall during the third quarter.
